fields.description:
Ad-hoc means:

# Create a JIRA issue e.g. TESTATLAS-1
# Create a review:
** Link the review to TESTATLAS-1
** In the review title, add "TESTATLAS-1"

Looking back at the "Reviews" tab in TESTATLAS-1, there is no review related to the issue despite the review created.

This feature, however, works if there is a changeset linked to TESTATLAS-1.

Note: Seems like a bug in Fecru rather than JIRA Studio. Reason:

* It works against standalone JIRA and Fecru at least version 2.4.3 
* It doesn't work against standalone JIRA and Fecru 2.3.7 (current version in JIRA Studio) 

Since there's no related Crucible bug report created for this, an upgrade to newer Fecru version in JIRA Studio might fix this
fields.summary: "Reviews" tab does not capture ad-hoc review linking

fields.description: The tests are currently sharing one PageBinder instance for every product. This PageBinder instance has a reference to a ProductInstance which is currently mutable (com.atlassian.studio.browsertest.framework.StudioProductInstance). The goal is to reuse the PageBinder instances from the product teams, e.g. com.atlassian.webdriver.jira.JiraTestedProduct and com.atlassian.webdriver.confluence.ConfluenceTestedProduct. Thus the com.atlassian.studio.browsertest.framework.StudioTestedProductTemplate has to be changed to be able to delegate to these instances instead.
fields.summary: Change Studio Webdriver tests to reuse JiraTestedProduct and ConfluenceTestedProduct

fields.description:
AOD-4093 removed a test from this test class because the test was unclear, flaky, and no longer testing what it was originally intended to test.

The Crucible permission scheme synchronisation process should be tested more thoroughly (and all options - create and update of a permission scheme for an existing project) should be exercised.

To do this, the test class should probably be moved out of the simple tests group and should implement a custom setup that sets up projects (and hence permission schemes) which allow testing of all request paths through CrucibleGlobalAdminServlet (for 'permissions' requests).
fields.summary: Make TestCruciblePermissionSchemesSynchronisation more comprehensive

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
As per http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/3rd+Party+Plugin+Process this a formal request for including the plugin *Agile Quality Management for Jira & Greenhopper* as bundled.

fields.description:
JIRA intermittently fails to come up in the build due to plugin time outs. This happens even with a timeout value of 10 mins.
If this happens on first startup, the build kills JIRA after a few minutes but before the timeout is reached: https://bamboo-extranet.atlassian.com/artifact/JST-NONGAPPS/JOBB/build-204/Application-logs/jira.log
If this happens after an import, we reach the end of the timeout period: https://bamboo-extranet.atlassian.com/artifact/JST-NONGAPPS/JOBE/build-204/Application-logs/jira.log

In the latter case, we see that the timeout is due to an unresolved dep on AppLinksManager:
{noformat}

fields.description:
This should:

* Depend on studio-fireball
* Use the [Unicorn Client Maven plugin|https://bitbucket.org/jroper/unicorn-java-client] to deploy it to a container specified by a system property
* Only do anything if the {{\-Punicorn-deploy}} profile is active
* Require (using the Maven Enforcer) the following system properties:
*# deployment username
*# deployment container hostname
*# fireball destination location
* Support both clean and upgrade builds if it's trivial to do so. Otherwise, upgrade now and clean can be a separate story.

fields.description:
We made loading of FishEye search results asynchronous when a search was issued to be across all repositories, because it had no way of searching across all repositories and so search requests had to be issued one by one and then aggregated, which on StAC currently times out because there are so many repositories.

I'm told there is now a cross repository index that we can search in, so this hacky code should be assassinated.
fields.summary: Assassinate FishEye asynchronous global search

fields.description:
The AAM deployment scripts replace {{/data/\*}} with a new directory structure from a template after running {{ant}} on a clean deploy. Because of this, the deployment scripts need to be change to copy the {{init.xml}} file created by the {{ant}} build to {{/data/jirastudio/home/}} after {{/data/\*}} is replaced. This needs to happen on an upgrade deploy too.

Something like this:

{code}
# Copy init.xml if it doesn't already exist
if [ ! -e /data/jirastudio/home/init.xml ] ; then
    echo "Copying init.xml"
    cp /opt/jirastudio/build/current/init.xml /data/jirastudio/home/init.xml
fi
{code}

It's important that the file should *not* be replaced by the one from the {{ant}} build if it already exists, as the trusted apps key pair will have changed.
fields.summary: Change AAM deployment scripts to copy initial data file to home directory

fields.description:
# Create a user whose full name is a CJKV string (an example of Chinese string: 徐壮) and make this user a developer and an administrator.
# Login as the newly created user and create a project the name of which is also a CJKV string (an example: DB数据后台处理加工平台).
# Go to Dashboard. We will see the following entry in the Activity Stream gadget:
{noformat}
    * ??  committed changeset 7 to the DB数据后台处理加工平台 project saying:
      New svn repository - initial commit by JIRA Studio
{noformat}
where the question marks should be the CJKV user name.
Note that the CJKV project name displays well.

Checked in Crowd. The CJKV user name is displayed correctly in Crowd. The same user name also displays fine in Studio admin pages, user menu, etc. So it looks like something went wrong within in the Stream gadget.
fields.summary: Multi-byte user name displayed as question marks in Activity Stream
